thread.title: Justin Timberlake receives Memphis Hall of Fame induction
thread.title_full: Justin Timberlake receives Memphis Hall of Fame induction | Entertainment & Showbiz from CTV News

author: Relaxnews
title: Justin Timberlake receives Memphis Hall of Fame induction
text:
On Saturday, Justin Timberlake was inducted into his hometown Memphis' Hall of Fame.
Introduced by close friend Jimmy Fallon, Justin Timberlake gave a twenty-minute acceptance speech at the 2015 Memphis Music Hall of Fame Induction ceremony. Praising fellow honorees, friends and family members, Timberlake put particular emphasis on the support of his wife, actress Jessica Biel.
During the ceremony, the singer/dancer/actor performed Otis Redding's 'Sittin' on) The Dock of the Bay' alongside fellow inductee Sam Moore (from 'Sam & Dave'). The event celebrated artists with a particular connection to Memphis, Timberlake's hometown. Other honorees included Booker T. & the MG's drummer Al Jackson Jr., Alberta Hunter, Memphis Slim, Charlie Rich and Elvis Presley guitarist Scotty Moore (inducted into the Hall by Keith Richards).
